Array: So, when are you leaving again, Taguchi?
Oh, come on! Do you really have to ask me that every
time you see me?
Well, I have good reason to. You've been over for
a long time now.
I haven't even been here ten minutes!
Naho, please don't be mean to Taguchi.
He's going to be helping me gather data again
tomorrow, you know.
But he's been coming over soooo often lately!
He's basically mooching off of our good will at
this point. And enough is enough, don't you think?
Normally, a house guest will be able to tell when
he's overstayed his welcome, but not Taguchi! He has
no compunctions about staying well past his prime.
I literally just got here!
Naho? That's enough, now. Heh.
Hahaha...
(Naho is always so mean to me, but deep down, I know
she's a good person...probably.)
(And all of my interactions with her, abusive though
they are, are absolutely precious memories to me
now.)
(I wouldn't trade my time with Mr. Kibiki and Naho
for anything. This footage is my rock... It's all
the inspiration I need to get through this.)
I paused the video for a moment on Naho's face,
cheeks puffed as she was readying herself to make
some sort of quip I'm sure I didn't deserve.
'So what's your fortune for today?
Horrible, rotten luck, was it?'
'You could at least wait till I read it before
planting that suggestion out there! Seriously!'
...Pff.
I set my camera down with a dull thud.
Heh... Hahahahahaha!
Hahahahahaha!
Phew... Those were good times.
Where did you get yourself off to, Mr. Kibiki?
I glanced down at my watch almost habitually, though
it was kind of pointless to do so.
(Still frozen in time, huh? Feels like it's been
around...I dunno, maybe two days since we got
separated? So hard to tell in this place...)
Mr. Kibiki! Mr. Kibiki!
There was something there...right there, just a few
seconds ago!
Where?!
There! Right over there!
Ahh...!
Hey, you! Wait! Stop!
Hold u--
--ULGH!!
Are you all right?!
Oof... I'm really sorry. I stepped on something
and...the camera! Is it all right?!
Seems to be.
UUWAAAAAAAAGGGGHH!!
AAAAAAAAAAAAGGGGGGGGHHHHHHHHH!!
AAAAAAHAAAHAAAAAAAAAAAAGGGHHH!!
Taguchi! Where are you going?!
(Right behind his back, I'd seen a light blue
figure...a ghost. And it scared me out of my wits!
I just bolted, and didn't look back.)
(It seemed to work, as I hadn't seen a single ghost
since. Unfortunately, I also hadn't seen Mr. Kibiki,
nor any other human beings for that matter.)
(Not any living human beings, anyway. Dead ones were
in plentiful supply, some telling stories of their
gruesome final moments through their injuries.)
(At first, I was capturing footage of them all,
excited for this exclusive scoop. But it didn't
take long for the novelty to wear away.)
(I began to realize that I was trapped in here. Not
a single window or door to the outside was budging.
It's like they were all just painted on.)
(The air was cold and stagnant, and I was completely
alone. No Mr. Kibiki, no anyone... Just me and a
whole host of increasingly worrisome corpses.)
(I almost felt like I was in quarantine or
something.)
(And the more time I took to stop and think about
my surroundings, the more I felt like I was going
to throw up.)
(All my hairs were standing on end and a chill to
end all chills ran through my spine, like a thousand
icicles had been jammed into my back.)
(I was going to be caged up in this awful school
until I died. I...was going to die here. Alone.)
*sigh*
Why the hell did I agree to come to this place,
anyway?
And why wasn't I smart enough to ask Mr. Kibiki how
to get back before running off?
...Seriously, how much of a dumbass does that make
me?!
I picked up my camera once more.
Wonder who took the tape out of this thing when
I threw it down and started running. Glad somebody
did, at least.
Cleared up some space for me to watch these old
movies I had in my shirt pocket. I knew they'd
be good luck to have along!
I pressed the button and began waxing nostalgic
over my former abuses once more.
'Naho, stop! If you hit Taguchi with that, you'll
kill him!'
'Mr. Kibiki! Thank you!'
'Well, then tell him not to use my sticker tags
without permission! I got those from Sayaka and
Aiko, and nobody gets to use them but ME!'
'I'm sorry! I'm so sorry! Look at me; I'm on my
knees here, begging for your forgiveness!'
(When you commit an event to video, you're able to
relive it at will through rose-colored lenses. It
can turn anything into a fond memory.)
(Video just holds so much more power than still
photography...)
...But I'm not gonna get anywhere if I just stand
here and reminisce all day, am I?
Memories are just fuel to help drive us forward.
And I've gotta keep moving, for as long as I can.
I need to get the hell out of here so I can forge
new memories with Mr. Kibiki and Naho. So I can go
back to the way things were before Heavenly Host...
Where did you go?! Come on! Don't leave me all by
myself!
That's a person. A girl!
Seiko... I'm scared! Where are you?!
*pant* *pant* *huff* *puff*
...I'm sorry, okay? I... I won't say anything
mean anymore...okay?
...Are you in here?
A person! Haha! That is one-hundred percent a
living human being! I finally found someone else
alive in this godforsaken place!
SSSSEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE
EEEEEEEEEEEIIIIIIIIIIIIIIII
IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIII
IIIIIIIIIKKKKKKOOOOOOOOOOOO
GEH!!
(That's sure not a human voice anymore...)
(It's almost like her jaw's completely detached
from her body. I've never seen a person's mouth
open that wide before.)
(Like a nutcracker or something!)
(And that voice is like it was pulled up from the
depths of hell. I can't imagine it isn't straining
her vocal chords to the breaking point.)
(It's more of a sound than a voice, really. High-
pitched and oscillating...almost mechanical...)
What... Whaaat the hell did I just see?
No, no, no, I can't take this right now.
I just want to go home!
Ulgh. This used to be a bathroom or something?
...Oh, hey, it's a ladder. Seems to lead upstairs
somewhere. Maybe I really am smelling a bathroom
after all.
But what's a ladder to a bathroom doing hidden
behind the janitor's room? Was the custodian here
a voyeur or something?! That's pretty skeezy...
I focused my gaze up to the top of the ladder.
Whoa...!
There, hanging onto one of the top rungs with one
arm, was a large man, his other arm clasped tightly
around the girl I'd seen before.
Ooooolllgh...
He stopped moving and seemed to be listening
intently. I...was pretty sure he'd heard me.
Aaaah... Crap...
Gaaaaaaaahhh!
(It's a monster!)
*pant* *pant*
What in the name of all that's holy IS that
monstrosity?!
[Day duty: ShinonomeÔºèKanno]
Aaagh!
Eeeeek!
The building entrance is frozen in place like
a model. It's not moving the slightest bit.
I-Is this the door? I dunno about this...
It looks pretty solid to me!
Charge into it
Back away
Geh!
Aaagh!
Eeeeek!
The building entrance is frozen in place like
a model. It's not moving the slightest bit.
I-Is this the door? I dunno about this...
It looks pretty solid to me!
Charge into it

Geh!
Aaagh!
Eeeeek!
The building entrance is frozen in place like

I-Is this the door? I dunno about this...
It looks pretty solid to me!
Charge into it

Geh!
The building entrance is frozen in place like
a model. It's not moving the slightest bit.
I-Is this the door? I dunno about this...
It looks pretty solid to me!
Charge into it
Back away
≈Åa!
Keep on recording and recording
After you die your face will warp and crumble
and be torn apart    on camera
The door leading inside is a malicious illusion.
Take heart and you can charge right through it.
No... NOOOOO!!
Gihh it baack!!
Gohhya!
Ghh! GHHAAH!!
Eye!
...! GhhhaaaaaaAAAAAAAAAAGGGGHHH!!
Graaaaaaaaaahhhhhhh...!
HEEEEEELP MEEEEEE...!!
Uuuullllllgggghhh...
*splut*
...Doehhn't fit...
Ghh..hhhh...
Aaagh!
Eeeeek!

im. Duch√≥w Niebieskich ‚Äî
Za oknem widaƒá drzewa rozpo≈õcierajƒÖcego siƒô

czarnymi w≈Çosami...
Gihh it back... Gihh it baaack!
Gaaaahh!
Ghh... Dammit! Why do I keep doing that?!
...Huh?
What? No!
You gotta be kidding me! It's busted?!
No, no, no, please, no... If I can't use my camera,
then what reason do I even have to be here?!
Goddammit!
*sob* *wail*
Naomi... *wail*
...That jerk...
(Another girl. Same uniform as the other one,
from the looks of it...)
(She could be possessed too, though. I'd better
keep myself hidden and follow her from a distance.)
*pant* *pant*
*huff* *puff*
Where the heck did she go...?
*pant* *pant*
(Aha! There she is!)
(Come on, you stupid thing... Work!)
(...Nothin' doin'. Damn.)
(Hmm?)
(What's going on? Something's definitely not
right here...)
I hear you...
Naomi...?
(Gotta keep on her tail.)
(The heck is that room?)
Oh, it's labeled. Well, that's handy!
'Custodian's Closet' -- so, the janitor's
office, then.
I took a peek inside, but there was no trace of
any living being. Emphasis on 'living.'
W-Well, might as well hop in for a second...
'I told everyone...that I'd go with them...'
'So why...have I been left behind...?'
'...It hurts... It hurts so much...'
Aaaagh!
Rrrg...ggghh...
Open up, dammit! OPEN UP!!
GLGH!!
Rrrg...ggghh...
(Nuh-uh. I ain't goin' back in there!)
The door seems affixed to the wall like a model.
It can't be opened.
GLGH!!
Rrrg...ggghh...
(I don't want to let that girl out of my sights
for too long. Let's see what she's up to.)
It's locked.
[Basement]
The door is nailed shut. It definitely won't be
opening anytime soon.
Do not enter under any circumstances.
-Principal Takamine Yanagihori
It's locked.
Back at the school entrance, huh? Maybe the doors
will finally let me out. I mean, they've gotta open
sometime, right?
Back at the school entrance, huh? Maybe the doors
will finally let me out. I mean, they've gotta open
sometime, right?
...Damn. Not today. How'd I know?
Stupid thing is solid as a brick wall.
Guess that would've been too easy.
Back at the school entrance, huh? Maybe the doors
will finally let me out. I mean, they've gotta open
sometime, right?
SSSSEEEEEEEEIIIIIIIIIKKKKKKKOOOOOO...
Aaaaagh!
It's locked.
[Infirmary]
The door is locked.
Ulgh, what an awful stench!
[Science Lab]
The door seems almost like a model, as if sculpted
onto the wall. There's no way of opening it.
It's locked.
No outsiders allowed.
Please vacate these premises immediately.
Set down your camera.
It's locked.
No outsiders allowed.
Please vacate these premises immediately.
Set down your camera.
There are hunks of some sort of unidentifiable meat
scattered about.
(I really hope this didn't used to be a person...)
It's locked.
There's a large gap in the floor here.
Crossing over would be far too risky.
Many devils lurk in the stairwell.
Keep alert and watch your step at all times.
The floors here are not to be trusted.
Ugh, what's going on? It's really cold here!
...Oh, G-G-God! BRR!! This is ridiculous!
I-I-I'm gonna f-f-freeze to death!
I've g-g-gotta go b-back!
*wheeze* *gasp* Nnnng...
Th-This is enough, now! Somebody, s-save me!
Please!
...Nnnngh...ghhh...
I kept trying to pick myself up off the ground...
...but all my energy was spent. Every time I almost
made it, I'd just tumble right over again.
Mr. Kibiki... I'm done for.
Just gonna...lie down...and wait till it's all
over...
Coward.
Taguchi.
N-Naho...? What in the... How are you here?!
A sudden feeling of relief washed over me, for the
first time since I'd come here.
Mr. Kibiki and I came to this place without you.
We specifically left you behind and came here in
secret so as not to involve you!
...And then you two got separated, right?
Y-Yeah, we did.
This realm is unstable and very, very dangerous.
I warned you both. Very clearly.
Two people can exist in the same space but in diff-
erent dimensions, and never see each other again.
And it's very easy to slip from one to the next.
Which is exactly what you did. You're no longer
in the same world as Mr. Kibiki. You've become lost
in another Heavenly Host.
And this realm is very old. Much older than the one
you entered through. It may have even been here for
hundreds of years already, in one form or another.
...For real?
Quick to accept things as ever, I see. It's your one
good point. Exactly the good point you'd hope for
from a gossip writer.
Well, it sure is good to see you, Naho!
Did you follow me here?
We should track down Mr. Kibiki and get the
hell out of here together!
Naho's expression turned stolid. She just stood
there, staring at me blankly.
Naho...?
I'm already dead.
...What?!
No... No, you can't be!
I looked her up and down several times,
incredulously, as if trying to find some
physical means of verifying her claim.
And, indeed, her body was faintly glowing like
a hologram, its edges blurring into the background.
That probably should've been a tip-off.
And I've searched high and low for Mr. Kibiki, all
throughout this school. He's nowhere to be found.
Even with all your spiritual talents...you still
couldn't find him?
My talents died with me. At least partially.
God... No... No, this is too cruel! Why did things
have to wind up like this?!
I looked down at my feet as I said this, deflated.
After becoming a spirit, I realized I could sense
life energies. And I'm not sensing Mr. Kibiki's at
all. I'm fairly certain...he's passed on as well.
I'll try to find some means of escape, though.
Even if you're the only one who can use it.
Then you can go back with all the footage you've
recorded.
Taguchi!
...Mr. Kibiki's gone...and so are you...
What point is there in me returning to a world
without you two in it?
There's nothing left for me! I don't even care
what happens anymore. I've lost the only things
that matter. I might as well die myself!
Just let me rest in peace.
I was basically in a fetal position at this point.
I didn't care anymore.
I just crossed my arms and stared at Naho.
She was here, but...she wasn't. She was dead.
And...glowering at me...
...which is right around when the floorboards
around me suddenly split apart.
At the sound of wood cracking and splintering,
I leaped to my feet.
This is what I meant when I said you were a coward,
you dumbass!
...! N-Naho--
You came here to help out Mr. Kibiki, same as me,
right?!
Well, now he's dead! So he's returning the favor,
trying to help YOU! How have you not noticed?!
She pointed to the wall nearby.
The wall where bloody letters had previously
appeared out of thin air.
Come to think of it, there have been a few times
now where messages have appeared like that and
saved my butt.
And you never put two and two together? You've seen
his handwriting countless times before! It's clearly
him!
Naho was practically shouting at this point, tears
streaming down her ghostly face.
And she was right.
I had seen this handwriting before, practically
every day of my working life. Those sophisticated
strokes and distinctive curves were unmistakable.
They were a living monument to the pen of a great
writer...
...writing his final words for my sake, and using
whatever 'ink' he had at his disposal to do it. It
was moving... It was uplifting... And it was sad...
If you give up on living now...
...then all of Kibiki's efforts will be in vain!
Suddenly, the busted camera on the floor
switched on.
This is something I can't do, now that I'm dead.
It's all up to you, Taguchi! You need to survive!
Naho had flipped her glasses up and was wiping the
tears from her eyes with the sleeve of her school
uniform as she made her appeal.
Heh... I mean, he even fixed my camera. So clearly,
you're right.
So I guess my mission now is...
I pointed the now fully operational camera directly
at Naho.
...to get the scoop of the century!
Naho's expression, as now captured on film, was
unusually soft and...dare I say, vulnerable?
I am Shougo Taguchi, cameraman for the great
Kou Kibiki.
I may have been separated from my boss, but
I promised him I'd keep on recording, no matter
what. And I intend to keep that promise.
I'll keep taping till the bitter end!
And these tapes will be the proof of my
accomplishments...the culmination of my
life's work.
...! What the...?
(That's definitely the same voice I heard before.
It's that girl who was walking around crying!)
I've gotta catch up with her!
*pant* *pant* *pant*
I'll continue recording for as long as possible.
That way, even if I don't make it, I can be a part
of the future for whoever stumbles in here next...
The stairs beyond this point are piled with rubble.
There's no way through.
[Infirmary]
Some unknown, ethereal force has completely sealed
the room. All attempts to enter are being blocked.
Check it out
Get away
(No, I've come too far to turn back now.
Let's do this.)
The back of the closet opened into a damp, dark
grotto. It felt like I was stepping into a natural
cave or something.
The hell is something like this doing behind
the janitor's office? ...And what's that smell?!
God, it's terrible!
I hope...Naomi's okay...
It's an old-fashioned space heater.
Something sticky seems to have melted all over its
surface. There are stains everywhere.
Every day up through November 18th, 1975 is crossed
off with a big X.
Inside the cabinet, there's a notebook labeled
'Night Guard Logbook.' Unfortunately, the cabinet
is locked.
It's an old, beat-up kettle.
Now where did that girl disappear to? She had to
have hidden in the closet...
...Ghh, can't open it!
There are old, moldy tea leaves floating in the
stagnant water.
[Science Lab]
The door is locked.
The boy's eyes are hollow cavities
that lead into oblivion.
Stay strong and avoid the temptation
to look directly at him.
Gooooot'hya...
Geh?!
(No... I can't move! What's going on?!)
I wohh lehh you go!
Ngah...haah!
I whant...your tongh...anh guts...
...! GhhhaaaaaaAAAAAAAAAAGGGGHHH!!
*sputter*
They're mine!
Ooolgghh...
Hee hee hee...
Hee hee hee...
Nobody alive in here. So where'd that girl go?
She hiding in the closet, maybe?
Looks empty to me...
...Er, wait. Are those air currents?
Go inside
Back away
The wall in the back...isn't solid...
With the slightest push, the plywood along the back
wall of the closet fell away to reveal a secret
passageway.

Looks empty to me...
...Er, wait. Are those air currents?

Back away
The wall in the back...isn't solid...
With the slightest push, the plywood along the back

Geeh!
If only I had something I could use to cross this...
If only I had something I could use to cross this...
